result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $200.00 fine plus costs. Fine and costs are paid  in full.
---------------------------

Pay DA service fees in the amount of $80.00. Paid in full.
----------------------------
Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge. Paid in full on this count.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with the victim.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended counseling.
----------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before May 1, 2015 @ 8:00 a.m.
The Defendant is to complete thirty (30) hours of community service work during EACH year of his two (2) year term of probation for a total of sixty (60) hours with NO BUYOUT.

Notice of Arrest

6/27/14 AMENDMENT TO CONDITIONS: NO CONTACT MODIFIED TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM.   "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

Must post $2,000.00 cash.   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.T.S. OR HER RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
See signature bond set 06/22/14
